deemed 
to  have  been  allowed  and 
the 
tax  charged

accordingly.  The 
receipt  of 
every  appeal 
shall  be
acknowledged (within thirty days of its receipt and where

so 
acknowledged, 
the 
date 
of 
the 
letter 
of
acknowledgement shall for the purposes of this section be
deemed to be the date of receipt of such appeal). Where

however 
the 
receipt 
of 
any 
appeal 
is 
not 
so
acknowledged, such appeal shall be deemed to have been
received  by  the  Commissioner-General  on  the  day  on

which 
it 
is  delivered 
to 
the  Commissioner-General.
